The bill: H.R. 6666, does not give the government the power to forcibly remove children from their homes. This claim is false and misleading.
The bill actually provides: 100 billion to fund COVID-19 contact tracing efforts. It aims to support organizations in conducting diagnostic testing, tracing and monitoring the contacts of infected individuals, and supporting their quarantine.
The legislation outlines a program to be: CDC) and grants will be awarded to eligible entities such as health centers, clinics, universities, and nonprofit organizations. These organizations will use the funds to hire, train, compensate, and pay the expenses of individuals involved in contact tracing efforts.
The bill focuses on contact tracing: which is a public health technique aimed at identifying individuals who have had contact with an infected person. The goal is to warn and potentially test or quarantine these individuals to prevent further spread of the virus. There is no provision in the bill that allows anyone to enter people's homes without consent for testing or quarantine purposes.
